ratings.rComments: Probably best professor I had on campus. Very enthusiastic and explains things very well. Lectures are very cool with cool demos and lots of interactivity. He is respected around the world in the physics community. Total hippie.  He is a must take for phys 211

I loved going to his class for a number of reasons. For one he was fantastic at explaining topics during lectures. He made the material fun to learn and is very personable. A few other perks are his collection of Hawaiian shirts and adorable dog he brings to class :)

Selen is a wonderful professor and made Physics easy to understand-if only if I could have had him in high school! He gives excellent lectures and truly cares about student's feedback. (Plus, his dog is incredibly cute and Selen brought him in 3 times this semester). Favorite professor so far, would definitely take any other classes by him!
Professor Selen has revolutionized UIUC's introductory physics education. He is an entertaining lecturer who truly cares about his students - a wonderful instructor all around.
Mats is an amazing guy and an excellent professor. If you ever get the chance to take one of his classes, do it. You won't regret it.

He is a brilliant professor. His fundamentals are very strong and he can teach really well. Thanks to him, this course is one of the best structured courses on campus. Physics 211 is quite the experience!
Definitely my favorite professor at U of I. I regret that I didn't go to his office hours more often to get to know him better. He's just awesome, inside and out :D

Physics genius.  Tries his best to make lectures interesting with music and lots of demonstrations, but doesn't do a great job of intuitively explaining things as most professors here don't.  Also my TA sucks, which doesn't help.
Great teacher and loves teaching physics. Also has really cool physics experiments/demos to show during lecture

Very fun teacher! However, he didn't really "teach" the material very much because we had to watch required pre-lectures with all the material. Lectures were interesting and sometimes helpful in understanding concepts.
Mats is the best. He also has the best taste in music.
Great at explaining material.  Students expected to do a lot of learning outside of class.  If you do all homework fully, you will do well in class.  Almost all necessary material is online.
Excellent Teacher. Physics has never been so clear!
Easily the best professor on the planet. Explains the concepts well and performs AMAZING demonstrations. If you're gonna take this class, make sure you have Mats. Oh, how I miss his lectures.
He's a good lecturer. He's great at explaining things and will take as much time as you need during office hours.
One of the best professors I've had. Makes lecture so entertaining, while actually doing a good job teaching. Class is hard, but not hard to get a good grade in. By the way, don't buy the textbook.
Great Professor, there are a lot of points in the class which makes it very hard to fail! Don't get the book though; it is basically the prelectures in written form.

Really really nice professor!! Having so much fun in his class. Professor Selen does all kinds of amazing experiment in class and sometimes gives us little "help in" i-cliker questions. He   is also very knowledgeable about the course (he one of the three main writers of textbook and the creator of the online HW system). Brilliant professor!
Explains very well and has a great sense of humor. Highly recommend him
He's too cool!!! Have the coolest demos and he is super funny
The best professor I have ever met. He is perfect!!!

Mats clearly loves what he does: teach physics.  He is dedicated to making sure you know his material, but you have to make the effort to seek his assistance when things get hard.  The class is taught by him and the SmartPhysics program.  The textbook (which he took part in writing) is pretty helpful, but just stick with SmartPhysics. Mats is great
Excellent teacher

Mats was one of my favorite professors. He is enthusiastic about physics and about teaching freshmen. His classes aren't boring, though much of it is review (because of pre-lecture assignments). He explains concepts very thoroughly.
Awesome guy. Explains really well. Class was somewhat easy for me since I learned this stuff in high school ap physics.
Selen was always very helpful and patient when explaining concepts and kept his lectures entertaining. I strongly recommend going to all the lectures and taking the online checkpoints seriously.

Professor Selen is awesome, definitely go to his lecture instead of Stelzer's if you can. The class has online homework, bonus points for showing up to lecture, and semi-weekly labs and quizzes. Definitely a manageable workload. Difficulty varies from person to person. So people never go to class and do great, others struggle with full effort.

best teacher ever! he does super interesting demos that help reinforce what you're learning, and looks for student feedback all the time. i definitely recommend him over stelzer, who taught our class one time when selen was out. he just wasnt nearly as good at explaining concepts as selen is.

definitely go to class he is a great lecturer and he does awesome demos, including blowing stuff and having students throw eggs at him. very easy class, and he is very in sync with the students as he asks for comments on every single homework question and actually reads them. homework load was about 2, 1-1.5 hour assignments per week
Great professor! Cares about his students, makes lecture as entertaining as possible. Lectures are clear and tailored to help with homework and student's questions.

Mats is a fun teacher. He definitely tries to keep the class interested in physics with good demos and examples. Personally, I really don't like physics, but his class made it less painful. He does well at explaining concepts and answering questions.
The best!! lectures are soo much fun!! i used to hate physics before this class! he is a damn cool dude!!
Awesome guy, plays rock music before class, you get bonus points if you can guess the bands.

Even though I never was a big fan of physics, I really enjoyed coming to lecture. Mats broke everything down and made sure we knew the basics. Homework, labs and quizzes were also very helpful. Exams could be pretty hard, and with such a large class the curve was usually low. Still, overall a good professor and tries his best to teach a hard class
Great prof for phys, homework hardest part of class which is not too bad.

This guy is great. My roommates & I nicknamed him Professor Sunshine because of his happy-go-lucky attitude & enthusiasm about physics. He's a good lecturer & does some cool demos. Furthermore, he has great taste in music & likes to rock out before class starts. You really can't go wrong with either him or Stelzer, though. Both are very good.
Great lecturer, very clear, interesting demonstrations. I most definitely would have gone to all of the lectures if I had a later lecture time.
Great teacher. Very entertaining and he makes sure you know the material. Enjoyable to go to class.

Really cool guy (even tho hes canadian).  Hes extremely helpful and really wants you to learn the material.  Very good in lecture, extremely knowledgeable but still good at breaking things down and explaining stuff.  And still likes to make stuff blow up in class.  Highly recommended.

Took class back in 1995. Glad to hear he is still at U of I, best physics experience there (ECE major). I have met several people in the aerospace industry that remind me of him... all successful! Pay attention to this guy!
Excellent lecturer and was VERY helpful during office hours and was very fast in replying to emails.  He explained the concepts well and was pretty humuorous too.
Made me want to not miss a single lecture.  He obviously loves his work and may not love teaching but he excels at it nonetheless.  One of the best professors I've ever had.
Awesome guy, really goes out of his way to make sure that you learn the material and have a good time doing it.
He 's a great guy who enjoys teaching and at the same time gd at teaching. His demos are AWESOME and he always makes you laugh~ he is fun, clear and HELPFUL~
Good guy
Great teacher and fun to have. Gets all the lecture done with at a reasonable pace. Always ready to help and a great guy.
real good guy...very clear...knows what hes talkin about...finally someone at u of i who speaks english :-)
Class was difficult, didn't teach in lecuture

The material was pretty hard, but Mats is the man!  He was constantly sending explosives into the room next to us, so lecture was a blast.  He's in high demand during office hours, however, so try to email him and set up some one on one.

i liked mats alot... he's very fun and keeps class interesting by blowing stuff up and having halftime... he's very good at breaking things down and explaining them... online homework is long, tedious, and much harder than the notes make the concepts out to be.  other than that, mats is an excellent professor :-)
Makes physics a lot less boring and even fun at times. Has lots of demonstations and lots of other random crap that he does.  Very interesting, very enthusiastic, very good!

Mats is a really great professor... He actually doesnt like being called "Professor" so just call him Mats. He explains everything very well and the hw is all online and is actually fairly easy to complete. He is a very social/active teacher who makes you want to go to his lectures (as opposed to skipping). Everyone likes Mats~!

Mats is a great professor. He's very willing to help students. He was usually clear in his explanations during office hours. However, I don't think that demos are always the way to go. Overall, Mats is awesome.
very enthusiastic, excellent at explaining- I agree with the monkey comment.
Very reasonable grader, open and helpful.  Fun to discuss issues with.  Willing to made adjustments for the student depending on the situation.
He could teach a monkey to understand physics.
He is very attentive to his students needs, and he makes the course easy and fun.  If you try, you'll do really well in his class.
